We feel that a more conservative approach is better for holding ourselves accountable to the commitments we make and stand behind.
Supply Chain Risk
Component delays and unexpected shortages can occur, but we’ve been building a thorough forecast with our key suppliers to help mitigate that risk. However, should unforeseen challenges present themselves, we’ll always keep you informed immediately and work quickly to solve the problem.

story:
The Librem 11 has everything you need to protect your digital life pre-installed in one convenient, portable 11.6" tablet/laptop/workstation with detachable keyboard included.

The Librem 10 is a compact, portable, privacy protecting 10.1" machine with detachable keyboard included.

The Best Privacy Protection — Preinstalled.

Librem takes the guesswork out of protecting your privacy and helps you surf the web safely, without being tracked by advertisers or marketers.

It comes preinstalled with the best Free/Libre and Open Source privacy and security software and apps for privacy "out of the box" -- including Tor browser, Duck Duck Go search engine, EFF Privacy Badger, and HTTPS: Everywhere.

A Tablet + Notebook + Workstation

Librem 11 is a sleek and powerful tablet computer with a fast and efficient Intel Core M-5Y10c processor mated with 8 GB RAM and 256 GB of SSD storage.

Librem 10 has the Intel Atom processor, 4 GB of RAM and all of the privacy and security features of the 11 at a lower price.

Quick Features

  • Runs any GNU/Linux distribution easily.
  • User upgrade-able — back easily unscrews.
  • Detachable keyboard included.
  • 6 to 8 hours of battery life.
  • Hardware Kill Switches for Camera/Microphone

Quick Benefits

  • Does NOT phone home to the parent company
  • Does NOT monitor your data or track you
  • No identification required to use or install applications
  • Designed to help protect you from ad trackers, malware, ransomware, and "surveillance capitalism."
  • Easily install your own OS, if you want
  • Developer friendly
  • No binary blobs (mystery code) required in Linux kernel
  • Allows YOU to control your own device
  • Completely free/libre and open source software
  • Protects your digital life without a corporate master key

Our Beliefs...

We believe in protecting your digital life.

We believe you should not be monitored nor recorded, without your consent.

We believe you should not surrender your freedom and your information to corporations for their profit.

At Purism, we make products designed to respect your digital rights.


Our Philosophy

  1. Purism will only use free/libre and open source software in the kernel, OS, and all software.

  2. Purism will design and manufacture hardware that respects users’ rights to privacy, security, and freedom.

  3. Purism will prioritize privacy, security, and freedom for our users.

  4. Purism will not discriminate against persons, groups, nor fields of endeavor.

  5. Purism will source, and manufacture the highest quality hardware.

  6. Purism will not monitor nor record any user information without explicit consent.

  7. Purism will offer full encryption tools and services for all users without holding the master key.

Purism will donate a portion of proceeds to free software projects on a quarterly basis, according to Purism’s own Free Software for Freedom Margin Share Program.


Minimizing Threats and Eliminating Corporate Control

Surveillance capitalism is on the rise. Controlling your computer and data is big business, Google, Microsoft and Facebook have become billion dollar corporations by harvesting and selling your digital life for their profit.

Aren't you tired of having your private life sold to the highest bidder?

Many operating systems, and all mobile operating systems forbid anonymous use. The Google Play Store, Apple App Store, and the latest versions of Windows forbid installing apps without registration of personal information. This is not a technical necessity, it is because their business model relies on monitoring your personal data and usage.

The Librem will never monitor you without your consent.

  • Do you want control over when you disclose your personal data?
  • Do you want a device that will not send your personal information to corporations and governments?
  • Do you want a mobile computer that doesn't double as a tracking device?
  • Do you want to know that when you turn your device off -- it's really off?

If so, you want a Purism Librem.

Here are some of the threats that are minimized and corporate control that is eliminated by using a Purism Librem:

Computers Built and Funded By the User, for the User

Purism Librem laptops are funded by the people, for the people, and designed with your comments, feedback, and ideas. We are the first personal computer company that welcomes and encourages your participation. We invite you to participate in our user forums, whether you own a Librem or not.

The Librem's free and open source software is community-developed by hundreds of thousands of volunteers all over the world -- with the source code available for all to participate and improve.

What Makes Purism's Librem Better than "Proprietary" Computers from Apple, Lenovo, Dell, Google and other vendors?

With proprietary systems, you do not know what is being sent to whom.

Let's look at just one example: wireless cards. All data that goes from your laptop to the outside world passes through your wireless card. Can you look into a proprietary wireless card to make sure it's not sending all that data to its manufacturer? Nope – how it works is a trade secret.

The wireless card – and every other component – of your Librem 11 is designed in accordance with the Librem open philosophy of keeping you in absolute control of your data.

And you don't have to take our word for it – because we use free software drivers in the kernel, where the source code can be verified so our claims are open to inspection by the global open source community. You are welcome to look in the kitchen and see how your food is made.

Your Librem laptop comes pre-loaded with software that is designed to protect your local data, online usage, and everything in between. The moment you turn on your Librem, you will be as protected as cryptographically possible.

The Librem 11 represents another concrete step toward fundamentally changing the computer industry. We believe in protecting your rights, and will continue to fight on behalf of those rights.

You are in control of your data and your device. Nobody else.

Go ahead, open it up. We trust you.

The back unscrews so you can upgrade it yourself. Nothing is glued down and it's neatly organized. 

How Can We Do This, When Other Companies Have Not?

When the average computer company sits down at the negotiation table, their priorities are price first, then quality, warranty, availability -- and then price again.

We are not the average computer company, We negotiate first for users’ rights, then quality, then price.

Since 2014, we have been sitting at the negotiating table with suppliers from all over the computer industry, arguing for technology that protects your rights.

We want you at the negotiating table with us.

We are here to create a revolution in the computer industry – you can help us do that by becoming part of the Purism family now! The more backers we have, the stronger position we are in when we go to suppliers to fight for your rights!


PureOS

Your Librem is bundled with PureOS 3.0 -- a "fork" of Debian GNU/Linux main, with added emphasis on privacy protection, we've also preinstalled the best privacy-protecting software applications. PureOS is fully free/libre and open source -- meaning you don't have to trust us that it respects and protects you, it is verifiable by security experts and software developers around the world.

PureOS Updates and Software Apps are Free -- Forever

We believe that when you own a laptop, you own it. You will not have to pay monthly charges or recurring payments to keep your software up to date.

All the software is included for free when you purchase any Librem product. There are no hidden agendas or “gotchas” like with some other companies out there.

Productivity Software Preinstalled:

We have hand selected what we believe to be the best free software applications to include with PureOS. These will allow you the same functionality as the office and productivity software you are used to -- but without the privacy, security, and freedom reducing trade offs such as data mining or relying on insecure cloud computing.

Librem let you do the things that you like to do -- privately and securely.

We wrote this copy, designed the Librem 11 3-D animations, edited the photos and edited our campaign video completely with these Free and Open Source apps!

Writing

Spreadsheet

Presentation

Drawing

Photo Editing

Audio Editing

Video Editing

3D Animating

What About Installing a Different OS or Apps?

Librem is your computer, and you can do what you want with it. That being said, we recommend using Operating Systems (OS) that fully respect your rights.


Manufacturing Versus Sourcing

Designing a laptop that meets the standards set by the Purism philosophy was hard. After a long search, we managed to find suppliers who would modify or provide a case, daughter cards, memory, drives, battery, camera, and screen that respected your rights to privacy and control of your data.

However, there was no motherboard currently on the market that met our principles. So we design and manufacture the motherboard ourselves. This is the only way we found to manufacture computer devices in accordance with the Purism business model and vision.

Librem 10 Hardware Specifications

We hand-select each chip and install only free software where the source code is available, making sure your Librem 10 protects your digital life. The hardware and software does not require any identification to own, operate, upgrade or use.

  • Intel Atom x5-Z8300 processor
  • 1.84 GHz
  • 4 Cores (4 Threads)
  • 2W
  • 8 to 10 hours battery life
  • 4GB maximum memory
  • DDR3L 1600MHz
  • 2 Mega pixel front camera
  • 5 Mega pixel rear camera
  • 10.1" 1920x1080p IPS panel
  • M.2 22*80
  • 802.11n wireless
  • RF hardware kill switch
  • Mic/Camera kill switch
  • 2 stereo speakers
  • 1 USB Type-C power port
  • 1 Audio jack
  • 1 Micro-USB 3.0 type-c port
  • 1 micro HDMI 1.4a port
  • 1 microSD
  • 1 4G NGFF slot
  • 1 Micro-SIM slot
  • Sensors including accelerometer, e-compass, gyroscope, and ambient light
  • Trackpad & touchscreen
  • Fanless design
  • 258.8 x 172.3 x 9.6mm (10.18" x 6.78" x .38")
  • 650g (1.43lbs)

Librem 11 Hardware Specifications

Like all Librem products we manufacture and source hardware that will only use free software where the source code is available.

  • Intel Core M-5Y10c processor
  • 2.0 GHz
  • 2 Cores (4 Threads)
  • 4.5W
  • 8 to 10 hours battery life
  • 16GB maximum memory
  • DDR3L 1600MHz
  • 2 Mega pixel front camera
  • 5 Mega pixel rear camera
  • 11.6" 1920x1080p FHD eDP panel
  • M.2 22*80
  • 802.11n wireless
  • RF hardware kill switch
  • Mic/Camera kill switch
  • 2 stereo speakers
  • 1 DC-in port
  • 1 Audio jack
  • 1 USB 3.0 port
  • 1 micro HDMI 1.4a port
  • 1 microSD
  • 1 4G NGFF slot
  • 1 Micro-SIM slot
  • 1 2048 pressure pen stylus
  • Sensors including accelerometer, e-compass, gyroscope, and ambient light
  • Trackpad & touchscreen
  • Fanless design
  • 296mm x 189mm x 11mm (11.65" x 7.44" x .43")
  • 850g (1.87lbs)

Librem 11 Peripherals

  • The Librem 11 power adapter takes up to 1.5A at 100-240V and 50-60Hz. As output, the power adapter provides up to 3.0A at 12V. The power adapter plug is available in EU, UK, and US styles and can be easily swapped out by the end user.
  • The keyboard comes in either US or UK layouts.
  • The optional docking station that has:
    • 1 Power Connector
    • 1 RJ45 Ethernet Port
    • 1 HDMI Port
    • 2 USB Ports


Librem 11 Peripherals

  • The Librem 11 power adapter takes up to 1.5A at 100-240V and 50-60Hz. As output, the power adapter provides up to 3.0A at 12V. The power adapter plug is available in EU, UK, and US styles and can be easily swapped out by the end user.
  • The keyboard comes in either US or UK layouts.
  • The optional docking station that has:
    • 1 Power Connector
    • 1 RJ45 Ethernet Port
    • 1 HDMI Port
    • 2 USB Ports


Hardware Kill Switches

All Librem products offer Hardware Kill Switches that physically sever the circuit at the hardware level for:

  • Wireless & Bluetooth
  • Camera & Microphone
The Librem 11 is planning to add hardware kill switches for:
  • Cellular card slot
  • GPS

There is an increasing threat of cameras and microphones being used to spy on you. Documents have shown plans to infect 'millions' of computers with malware called CAPTIVATEDAUDIENCE, which turns a computer's microphone into a bug, and GUMFISH, which turns your camera into a spycam. Such attacks will only become more common in the future. We decided to stop these types of attacks entirely: with switches that physically sever the circuit to the microphone and camera. Try hacking that!

All Purism Librem Products:

  • Librem 10: A 10.1" 2-in-1 Intel Atom based tablet/notebook
  • Librem 11: An 11.6" 2-in-1 Intel Core M based tablet/notebook
  • Librem 13: A 13.3" Intel i5 based laptop
  • Librem 15: A 15.6" Intel i7 based laptop

When Will I Get My Librem?

The first batch will be ready September 2016. This date allows us to finalize our design, manufacture a small run, then order the components, assemble them, load the software and ship to you.

Shipping Costs

$80 US domestic shipping.

$115 International shipping. Any applicable international customs and duties are not included in the price and are the responsibility of the recipient.

Warranty

Every Librem comes with a two-year warranty, covering parts and labor. We currently have one facility in South San Francisco for repairs. However we are also pursuing distribution and warranty repair within other countries.

Replacement and Upgrade Parts

Once we are shipping from stock in September 2016, we will also offer replacement and upgrade parts for sale.

Future Models

In the future the Purism team will be putting out a phone... stay tuned.

Business Challenges

The biggest challenge we face at Purism is delays in the supply chain. We are getting better at managing these delays, but since we are buying small, but growing, supply runs, we don't yet have enough leverage to make strong demands upon our suppliers.

We can overcome these delays by placing larger orders, stocking items in-house, and making suppliers compete for faster delivery times. Your order today adds an extra bit of weight to our demand.

What Stage of Manufacturing are you at now?

The final prototypes of the Librem 11, and the Librem 10 are completed. With your help we can begin a full-scale production run at our South San Francisco facility.

Plans After Successfully Funding

We have very big plans, we believe in protecting your digital life. We want technology that does just that to become the default for all users. We want average computer users to consider the Librem line an easy alternative to proprietary systems that engage is surveillance capitalism.

Our next product will be a Librem phone! It will have all the same protection benefits of our other products, but in a smaller form factor. You will, for the first time, be able to control your mobile phone.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot help by pre-ordering a Librem 11, or by donating to our cause, there are a number of other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word on your favorite social media
  • Use free software, which strips power from proprietary software
  • Sign the "Remove the Intel Management Engine (ME-less)" Petition
  • Volunteer on our team, we have all sorts of things we're trying to do. Drop a line to hr@puri.sm and let us know you're interested.
  • If you're a developer, join our development team! Get in touch with hr@puri.sm today.

Sales After the Campaign Succeeds

Our crowdfunding goal allows us to place what is known in the business as a Minimum Order Quantity (MOQ) order. Once this order is in, the Librem will go on sale through our website and resellers. Once we are shipping from stock, around September 2016, the turn-around for new orders will be 1 to 2 weeks.

Stretch Goals

>= $550,000 = Released Coreboot for Librems

Coreboot for all devices; we have been working with volunteer Coreboot developers over the past year, providing hardware to get Coreboot initially developed for the Librem 13, but we need to devote more resources to this cause for all our devices. Having a volunteer effort alone will not suffice, so reaching this stretch goal will allow us to give Coreboot development the resources it deserves.

>= $750,000 = Freed BlueTooth Driver

There are no free software drivers for NGFF or minipcie Bluetooth drivers. We must change that to take full advantage of the Bluetooth standard, the protocol, and the devices that use Bluetooth. If we reach this stretch goal we can devote enough resources to free a Bluetooth driver.

>= $950,000 = Freed Wireless AC Driver

There are no free software drivers for Wireless AC, and we need to change that. If we reach this stretch goal we will have enough resources to devote to freeing the 802.11ac wireless drivers.

>= $1,250,000 = Full HTML5 App Store

Although we want to make all the basic app functions available with free software, some common native apps are proprietary. In these cases, we can replace them with web-based counterparts that run on HTML5. We can maximize our impact on the computer industry with a full app store that auto-builds native free software apps. This will allow developers to easily include free apps by default. But we also want to scour the web for popular HTML5 apps to include in our app store. This stretch goal would allow us to devote the resources necessary to create the app store, making using free software easier for the broadest audience, and more functional.

Sign Our "Remove the Intel Management Engine (ME-less)" Petition

Sign the petition to free Intel CPUs from the Management Engine (ME).
The consumer Management Engine is a binary 'blob' (piece of firmware) required for Intel CPUs. We have been working with our partner Intel to make this blob free for the community to inspect and alter.
Intel has told us they cannot free the ME for existing products, but they are interested in hearing from you, to see if you want to have an "ME-less" (Intel's internal name for our request) design in future CPUs.
Please take a moment to sign our petition to request Intel to create an ME-less CPU.
Your voice will be the difference between having an ME (bad) or not having the ME (good!). We have verified the ME is not required to operate the Librem, but Intel has a watchdog that powers off the CPU if the ME is not present.

About Purism

We believe in protecting your digital life. We make high quality products that respect your rights to privacy, security, and freedom. We are based in South San Francisco, California, USA.

Team

Todd Weaver — Founder & CEO

Todd Weaver, Founder of Purism, a serial entrepreneur and successful businessman, has been recognized for his visionary strategy, technical leadership, and relentless drive. Todd has more than 20 years of entrepreneurial experience, using, installing, and promoting free software. Todd has consistently predicted market directions and executed disruptive technologies in a wide range of industries, including in-store entertainment, collaborative financial solutions, and starting the first online cable company.
Todd has a deep understanding of the hardware manufacturing process, and an unwavering belief for users to retain their essential freedoms via free software. Making Purism (the marriage of high quality hardware and free software), his most ambitious, disruptive, and exciting venture yet.
Todd believes in company growth through enabling others. He can explain the complex simply, make the difficult easy, and excite those he surrounds

Zlatan Todorić — Director of Technology

Zlatan Todorić is a die-hard Free software developer. Emerging from realms of Debian, with its strict ethical adherence to user Freedom, blends perfectly into Purism.
The combination of his mechanical/ mechatronic engineering background and being a Software/ System engineer for almost a decade now shows how wide-ranging his expertise is.
Zlatan already worked in many fields of industry: industrial electronics, web development and design, software architecture, 3D printing, games.
His passion and devotion towards Free software is now combined with his ultimate goal – giving users the Freedom. As a long-time community member, he invites all people to join him in designing our future. Make your own device with his help.

Jay Kuri — Kernel Developer

Jay Kuri’s passion is solving seemingly impossible problems and asking needed but impertinent questions. He has been working with application development and internet systems architecture and operations since 1994. In the years since, he has developed software deployed on everything from portable e-book readers to 800-machine web clusters.
Jay’s open source software saga began when he downloaded FreeBSD 1.0 onto 40 floppy disks in 1994. He has been contributing or authoring Free and Open Source Software ever since. Jay believes that closed software practices tend to lead to poor quality software and too often an end-user who is treated more like a villain than a customer. Jay is out to change that, to restore control over what end-users (or as he likes to call them ‘regular people’) use and what they share, and to make software development itself more accessible.
When Jay is not developing software, he can be found riding motorcycles, teaching kids how to program, travelling, riding motorcycles, studying numerous non-software related subjects… or riding motorcycles.

Adrian Alves — PureOS Developer

Linux System Administrator since 1999, started with GNU/Linux and Debian specifically in 1998, in 2007 Adrian started working as a package manager for an enterprise GNU/Linux distribution, continuing consistent development with Debian based packages.
Adrian is part of the Debian Java team and is also an official Fedora package maintainer whom has also worked in the Fedora infrastructure team.
Adrian loves to work with GNU/Linux packages and really enjoys working with Debian GNU/Linux.

James Rufer — Director of Product

James comes to Purism as the Director of Product. His desire is to make Pure OS easier and more comfortable to operate for the average computer user. As we learn more and more about how our behavior and activities are tracked, monitored, packaged and resold, James believes that private and secure software and hardware are increasingly needed.
Although other operating systems are not going away anytime soon and will continue to be used in both professional and personal environments, James believes that we should have the option to keep our activities private and secure and to eliminate the feeling that someone is watching over our shoulder. Finally, this software should “just work” to relieve any frustration on the part of the consumer.
James likes to spend his spare time hanging out with nice people, playing “vidia” games, reading and consuming media.

Hema Prathaban — PureOS Developer

Hema started to use Linux from 2008, she is a woman who loves to code and learn different things. Having been working as intern with Intel through outreach program for women, she has worked on thermal sensor devices. She has worked in emerging companies creating awareness among female students about free/libre and open source software. Guiding them, and educating them to learn about Linux kernel hacking.
She loves to program using C.

François Téchené — Director of Creative

François is a French film maker and animator who dedicates himself to promoting freedom of creativity. He believes that being able to freely access, share, study and improve the essence of anyone’s creativity is essential for our global evolution and harmony. It is not just about software.
Previously, François mainly used proprietary technologies but has made the move to only use free & open source software and formats for the entire workflow of his visual creations. He believes that free technologies are now mature enough to be used in a professional film production environment. He is not going back.
François comes from a software programming background so he also dedicates some of his time to contributing to free software projects in multimedia creation such as the 2D animation software Pencil2D.
He is co-founder of the Ethic Cinema foundation that aims to promote free access to film making creativity and techniques.
story_txt:
The Librem 11 has everything you need to protect your digital life pre-installed in one convenient, portable 11.6" tablet/laptop/workstation with detachable keyboard included.


The Librem 10 is a compact, portable, privacy protecting 10.1" machine with detachable keyboard included.






The Best Privacy Protection — Preinstalled.
Librem takes the guesswork out of protecting your privacy and helps you surf the web safely, without being tracked by advertisers or marketers.It comes preinstalled with the best Free/Libre and Open Source privacy and security software and apps for privacy "out of the box" -- including Tor browser, Duck Duck Go search engine, EFF Privacy Badger, and HTTPS: Everywhere.




A Tablet + Notebook + Workstation

Librem 11 is a sleek and powerful tablet computer with a fast 
and efficient Intel Core M-5Y10c processor mated with 8 GB RAM and 256 GB of SSD storage.

Librem 10 has the Intel Atom processor, 4 GB of RAM and all of the privacy and security features of the 11 at a lower price.



Quick Features

Runs any GNU/Linux distribution easily.
User upgrade-able — back easily unscrews.
Detachable keyboard included.
6 to 8 hours of battery life.
Hardware Kill Switches for Camera/Microphone



Quick Benefits
Does NOT phone home to the parent company
Does NOT monitor your data or track you
No identification required to use or install applications
Designed to help protect you from ad trackers, malware, ransomware, and "surveillance capitalism."
Easily install your own OS, if you want
Developer friendly
No binary blobs (mystery code) required in Linux kernel
Allows YOU to control your own device
Completely free/libre and open source software
Protects your digital life without a corporate master key



Our Beliefs...
We believe in protecting your digital life. We believe you should not be monitored nor recorded, without your consent. We believe you should not surrender your freedom and your information to corporations for their profit. At Purism, we make products designed to respect your digital rights.



Our Philosophy


Purism will only use free/libre and open source software in the kernel, OS, and all software. 


Purism will design and manufacture hardware that respects users’ rights to privacy, security, and freedom. 


Purism will prioritize privacy, security, and freedom for our users. 


Purism will not discriminate against persons, groups, nor fields of endeavor. 


Purism will source, and manufacture the highest quality hardware. 


Purism will not monitor nor record any user information without explicit consent.


Purism will offer full encryption tools and services for all users without holding the master key.


Purism will donate a portion of proceeds to free software projects on a quarterly basis, according to Purism’s own Free Software for Freedom Margin Share Program.


Minimizing Threats and Eliminating Corporate Control
Surveillance capitalism is on the rise. Controlling your computer and data is big business, Google, Microsoft and Facebook have become billion dollar corporations by harvesting and selling your digital life for their profit. Aren't you tired of having your private life sold to the highest bidder?Many operating systems, and all mobile operating systems forbid anonymous use. The Google Play Store, Apple App Store, and the latest versions of Windows forbid installing apps without registration of personal information. This is not a technical necessity, it is because their business model relies on monitoring your personal data and usage. The Librem will never monitor you without your consent.
Do you want control over when you disclose your personal data?
Do you want a device that will not send your personal information
to corporations and governments?

Do you want a mobile computer that doesn't double as a tracking device?
Do you want to know that when you turn your device off -- it's really off?


If so, you want a Purism Librem. 

Here are some of the threats that are minimized and corporate
control that is eliminated by using a Purism Librem:



Computers Built and Funded By the User, for the User
Purism Librem laptops are funded by the people, for the people, and designed with your comments, feedback, and ideas. We are the first personal computer company that welcomes and encourages your participation. We invite you to participate in our user forums, whether you own a Librem or not.The Librem's free and open source software is community-developed by hundreds of thousands of volunteers all over the world -- with the source code available for all to participate and improve.



What Makes Purism's Librem Better than "Proprietary" Computers from Apple, Lenovo, Dell, Google and other vendors?

With proprietary systems, you do not know what is being sent to
whom. 
Let's look at just one example: wireless cards. All data that goes
from your laptop to the outside world passes through your wireless
card. Can you look into a proprietary wireless card to make sure it's
not sending all that data to its manufacturer? Nope – how it works
is a trade secret.
The wireless card – and every other component – of your Librem
11 is designed in accordance with the Librem open philosophy of keeping
you in absolute control of your data. And you don't have to take our
word for it – because we use free software drivers in the kernel,
where the source code can be verified so
our claims are open to inspection by the global open source community. You are welcome
to look in the kitchen and see how your food is made.
Your Librem laptop comes pre-loaded with software that is designed
to protect your local data, online usage, and everything in
between. The moment you turn on your Librem, you will be as protected
as cryptographically possible.
The Librem 11 represents another concrete step toward
fundamentally changing the computer industry. We believe in
protecting your rights, and will continue to fight on behalf of those
rights.You are in control of your data and your device. Nobody else.


Go ahead, open it up. We trust you.
The back unscrews so you can upgrade it yourself. Nothing is glued down and it's neatly organized. 



How Can We Do This, When Other Companies Have Not?
When the average computer company sits down at the negotiation
table, their priorities are price first, then quality, warranty,
availability -- and then price again. 
We are not the average computer company, We negotiate first for
users’ rights, then quality, then price.
Since 2014, we
have been sitting at the negotiating table with suppliers from all
over the computer industry, arguing for technology that protects your
rights. 

We want you at the negotiating table with us. 

We are here to create a revolution in the computer industry –
you can help us do that by becoming part of the Purism family now!
The more backers we have, the stronger position we are in when we
go to suppliers to fight for your rights!


PureOS
Your Librem is bundled with PureOS 3.0 -- a "fork" of Debian 
GNU/Linux main, with added emphasis on privacy protection, we've also preinstalled the best privacy-protecting 
software applications. PureOS is fully 
free/libre and open source -- meaning you don't have to trust us that it 
respects and protects you, it is verifiable by security experts and 
software developers around the world. 


PureOS Updates and Software Apps are Free -- Forever

We believe that when you own a laptop, you own it. You will not
have to pay monthly charges or recurring payments to keep your
software up to date.
All the software is included for free when you
purchase any Librem product. There are no hidden agendas or “gotchas”
like with some other companies out there.
Productivity Software Preinstalled:
We have hand
selected what we believe to be the best free software applications to
include with PureOS.  These will allow you the same
functionality as the office and productivity software you are used to -- but without the privacy,
security, and freedom reducing trade offs such as data mining or
relying on insecure cloud computing. Librem let you do the things that you like to do -- privately and securely.We wrote this copy, designed the Librem 11 3-D animations, edited the photos and edited our campaign video completely with these Free and Open Source apps! 
WritingSpreadsheetPresentationDrawingPhoto EditingAudio EditingVideo Editing3D Animating

What About Installing a Different OS or Apps?
Librem is your computer, and you can do what you want with it. That being said, we recommend using Operating Systems (OS) that fully respect your rights.


Manufacturing Versus Sourcing
Designing a laptop that meets the standards set by the Purism
philosophy was hard. After a long search, we managed to find
suppliers who would modify or provide a case, daughter cards, memory, drives, battery, camera, and screen that respected your rights to privacy and control of your data.
However, there was no motherboard currently on the market that met
our principles. So we design and manufacture the motherboard ourselves. This is the only way we found to manufacture computer devices in
accordance with the Purism business model and vision.


Librem 10 Hardware Specifications
We hand-select each chip and install only free software where the source code is available, making sure your Librem 10 protects your digital life. The hardware and software does not require any identification to own, operate, upgrade or use.


Intel Atom x5-Z8300 processor
1.84 GHz
4 Cores (4 Threads)
2W
8 to 10 hours battery life
4GB maximum memory
DDR3L 1600MHz
2 Mega pixel front camera
5 Mega pixel rear camera
10.1" 1920x1080p IPS panel
M.2 22*80
802.11n wireless
RF hardware kill switch
Mic/Camera kill switch
2 stereo speakers
1 USB Type-C power port
1 Audio jack
1 Micro-USB 3.0 type-c port
1 micro HDMI 1.4a port
1 microSD
1 4G NGFF slot
1 Micro-SIM slot
Sensors including accelerometer, e-compass, gyroscope, and ambient light
Trackpad & touchscreen
Fanless design
258.8 x 172.3 x 9.6mm (10.18" x 6.78" x .38")
650g (1.43lbs)



Librem 11 Hardware Specifications
Like all Librem products we manufacture and source hardware that will only use free software where the source code is available.


Intel Core M-5Y10c processor
2.0 GHz
2 Cores (4 Threads)
4.5W
8 to 10 hours battery life
16GB maximum memory
DDR3L 1600MHz
2 Mega pixel front camera
5 Mega pixel rear camera
11.6" 1920x1080p FHD eDP panel
M.2 22*80
802.11n wireless
RF hardware kill switch
Mic/Camera kill switch
2 stereo speakers
1 DC-in port
1 Audio jack
1 USB 3.0 port
1 micro HDMI 1.4a port
1 microSD
1 4G NGFF slot
1 Micro-SIM slot
1 2048 pressure pen stylus
Sensors including accelerometer, e-compass, gyroscope, and ambient light
Trackpad & touchscreen
Fanless design
296mm x 189mm x 11mm (11.65" x 7.44" x .43")
850g (1.87lbs)



Librem 11 Peripherals

The Librem 11 power adapter takes up to 1.5A at 100-240V and 50-60Hz. As output, the power adapter provides up to 3.0A at 12V. The power adapter plug is available in EU, UK, and US styles and can be easily swapped out by the end user.
The keyboard comes in either US or UK layouts.
The optional docking station that has:
 

1 Power Connector
1 RJ45 Ethernet Port
1 HDMI Port
2 USB Ports

When Jay is not developing software, he can be found riding motorcycles, teaching kids how to program, travelling, riding motorcycles, studying numerous non-software related subjects… or riding motorcycles.
Adrian Alves — PureOS Developer

Linux System Administrator since 1999, started with GNU/Linux and Debian specifically in 1998, in 2007 Adrian started working as a package manager for an enterprise GNU/Linux distribution, continuing consistent development with Debian based packages.

    Adrian is part of the Debian Java team and is also an official Fedora package maintainer whom has also worked in the Fedora infrastructure team.

    Adrian loves to work with GNU/Linux packages and really enjoys working with Debian GNU/Linux.
James Rufer — Director of Product

James comes to Purism as the Director of Product. His desire is to make Pure OS easier and more comfortable to operate for the average computer user. As we learn more and more about how our behavior and activities are tracked, monitored, packaged and resold, James believes that private and secure software and hardware are increasingly needed.

    Although other operating systems are not going away anytime soon and will continue to be used in both professional and personal environments, James believes that we should have the option to keep our activities private and secure and to eliminate the feeling that someone is watching over our shoulder. Finally, this software should “just work” to relieve any frustration on the part of the consumer.

    James likes to spend his spare time hanging out with nice people, playing “vidia” games, reading and consuming media.
Hema Prathaban — PureOS Developer

Hema started to use Linux from 2008, she is a woman who loves to code and learn different things. Having been working as intern with Intel through outreach program for women, she has worked on thermal sensor devices. She has worked in emerging companies creating awareness among female students about free/libre and open source software. Guiding them, and educating them to learn about Linux kernel hacking.

    She loves to program using C.
François Téchené — Director of Creative

François is a French film maker and animator who dedicates himself to promoting freedom of creativity. He believes that being able to freely access, share, study and improve the essence of anyone’s creativity is essential for our global evolution and harmony. It is not just about software.

    Previously, François mainly used proprietary technologies but has made the move to only use free & open source software and formats for the entire workflow of his visual creations. He believes that free technologies are now mature enough to be used in a professional film production environment.
    He is not going back.

    François comes from a software programming background so he also dedicates some of his time to contributing to free software projects in multimedia creation such as the 2D animation software Pencil2D.

    He is co-founder of the Ethic Cinema foundation that aims to promote free access to film making creativity and techniques.

story:
DictationBridge: Seamless Speech Recognition for Blind Computer Users

These days it's no big deal to request songs, rides, lights and the current temperature with a few spoken commands to one's computer or mobile device. It's no wonder the technology has found its way into the workplace, where professionals use their voice to be efficient at their PC, but blind people and others with disabilities must pay extra for a convenience everyone else takes for granted. DictationBridge plugs right into today's leading screen readers to provide blind and otherwise disabled people using voice recognition an experience as efficient as everyone else enjoys. Please help us close the gap between screen reading and speech recognition technologies.

Upon its release, DictationBridge will be free software using every definition of the word "free." All of its source code will be released so people in the community with programming skills can make changes, add features or do whatever they choose with it. End users will never need to pay a penny to use the software as it will forever be a no-cost download.

DictationBridge At A Glance

The DictationBridge team is designing, coding, testing and documenting a sophisticated plug-in for NVDA, Window-Eyes, ZoomText Fusion and JAWS that will:

  • Support critical dictation features including: echo back, full speech recognition UI access, and editing with voice only
  • Provide access to all versions of Dragon from Nuance, including Dragon Pro, and Windows Speech Recognition (WSR) (Note that WSR is currently not compatible with JAWS)
  • Use voice command and control as is supported by the voice recognition package being employed and the ability to issue screen reader commands if the user owns Dragon Professional
  • Integrate with the target screen readers using native commands
  • Require no changes to the screen reader's default scripts or configurations
  • Provide 100% of its source code to the community upon final release. The main DLL, Window-Eyes, ZoomText Fusion and JAWS scripts will carry the Mozilla Public License 2.0 and the NVDA scripts will use GPL 2 or later.
  • Include complete, professionally written documentation for easy operation
  • Feature email technical support at a nominal annual subscription price

You can learn even more about DictationBridge at the project web site.

Our Team of Experts

DictationBridge is coming together on the strength of a top flight coalition of accessibility innovators. Matt Campbell, author of SystemAccess and the other Serotek products, is leading a team of respected names well-known in the world of accessibility and hands free computing, including: Lucy Greco, Erin Lauridsen, Pranav Lal, Sue Martin, Debra Kaplan, Bryan Smart, Amanda Rush, Jeff Bishop, Tyler Spivey and Joe Orozco. 3 Mouse Technology and Serotek Corporation are contributing their top talent to a project everyone agrees is essential for today's modern computer user.

How Does It Work?

Think of DictationBridge as four separate software components. The majority of the functionality lives in a DLL that communicates with the various supported screen readers. The other three components are the individual scripts for NVDA, Window-Eyes and ZoomText Fusion, and JAWS that handle the operation for those specific utilities.

Blind computer users typically interact with screen readers using a series of keyboard commands. However, there are many screen reader users with additional impairments, such as learning disabilities or repetitive strain injuries who benefit from speech recognition to get things done in a manner compatible with their disabilities and more efficiently in general. Working within the capabilities of Dragon and Windows Speech Recognition, a person with a disability can use DictationBridge to dictate to command and control their computers with minimal exertion. Writing e-mails, searching the web, and collaborating on documents no longer has to be a physical burden for those who use DictationBridge.

Check out an audio demonstration of DictationBridge! You can also hear members of the DictationBridge team talking about the project on BlindBargains, at NVDA Con and on Main Menu.

Gone are the days when blind users needed specific screen readers to accomplish custom tasks. Though DictationBridge will initially be coded for and tested against NVDA, the speech recognition plug-in will be made to work with JAWS, Window-Eyes and ZoomText Fusion as well. We plan to make the plug-in as robust as possible within the constraints inherent in each screen reading utility.

We hope that DictationBridge will find its way into the hands of as many blind users as possible. In fact, if used with the built-in Windows dictation system and the NVDA screen reader, users can enjoy DictationBridge at absolutely no cost. For users with custom needs, DictationBridge will work with several variants of Dragon products from Nuance. Though certain advanced features may require the use of Dragon Professional, DictationBridge is meant to be compatible with as many of the less expensive Dragon products as well.

Why You Should Add Your Voice

The DictationBridge team reaches out to you because we think you get it. Unlike many people who believe we have come far enough in technological advancements for persons with disabilities, you know better. You've read the same headlines that scream of popular mainstream features that do not work out of the box for the more than 65 million blind people around the world, and like us, you believe this population should not have to pay more to make these features work equally for all. That's why we need you to become a part of the DictationBridge project today.

With your generous investment we will:

  • Pay the programmers responsible for the magic under the hood
  • Set up a highly qualified technical support system ready at product launch
  • Prepare the comprehensive documentation you need to use the plug-in as intuitively as possible
  • Pay a one-time licensing fee to Serotek Corporation for use of their source code. DictationBridge started as a piece of the SystemAccess screen reader where it was written by Matt Campbell, lead developer on DictationBridge. Buying the code from Serotek permitted us to make DictationBridge as a free software package, to have the copyright for that part of the code transfered to our team and to permit Matt to work on the project. Plain and simply, we could not have done this project at all without working with Serotek in this cooperative and collaborative fashion.

The DictationBridge Milestones

As this is a "flexible funding" Indie Go-Go campaign, the DictationBridge team will get the dollars contributed even if it doesn't make the entire $20,000 goal. The following are the different milestones that the fundraiser may reach and what the team will do at each funding level:

  • $7500 - the minimum. When the dollars contributed reach this level, the team will commence work on turning the demo into a real piece of software and will support the NVDA screen reader and Windows Speech Recognition.
  • $10,000 - support for the entire line of Dragon products is included.
  • $12,500 - The team adds scripts for Dragon Professional, permitting users to issue screen reader commands via voice.
  • $15,000 - DictationBridge includes support for Window-Eyes and ZoomText Fusion.
  • $17,500 - Within its limitations, the team adds a plug-in for JAWS to be able to access DictationBridge.
  • $20,000 - Our ultimate goal in which the team builds and releases the "gold plated" version of DictationBridge.

For more details about what will be done at each separate funding level, please read this piece about DictationBridge milestones on the project web site.

We appreciate your generosity in helping to accomplish our shared mission of making accessibility a right, not an afterthought.

The Obligatory Legalese

DictationBridge is a trademark of 3 Mouse Technology. Dragon is a trademark of Nuance Corporation, Windows is a trademark of Microsoft Corporation, NVDA is a trademark of NVAccess Foundation, JAWS is a trademark of Freedom Scientific, Window-Eyes and ZoomText Fusion are trademarks of AI Squared, and SystemAccess Is a trademark of Serotek Corporation.

story:
Update 27/08/2013

Comparison of the Cellular IOT board with other GSM Board (click to enlarge)

We Have also noticed many of contributors are getting confusion on Perk value, so please go through Perk List before you contribute. 

(Note: International Shipping cost of $8 is not included). We have also added Shipping Perk, in case you have forgot to add shipping.


What is it?

This is an open source Cellular IOT Development platform with custom firmware fully Arduino compatible, design to work as IOT Device, for IOT Device that Everyone Can Afford.

IOT: Internet Of Things

This affordable platform is packed in SIM900 SoC (System on Chip) Based on ARM926EJ core Runs at 156MHz with Quad band GSM baseband.

On board high sensitive 66-channel GPS with AGPS & DGPS support, uSD card for data logging, USB interface and lots more.


What it is not?

It is not just another DIY cellphone platform. This is definitely not a Mobile phone.

 

Arduino Compatible

As we all know Arduino is Maker’s first choice for any electronics project and we all like to work on Arduino, because it’s simple to program and flexible to interface. We followed the same simplicity and flexibility with our board.

Out of your imagination we have made official Arduino GSM library 100% working on our Board. Our Custom Firmware allows you to take full flexibility from Arduino GSM Library. (Please note Arduino GSM shield use different GSM module, so till now Arduino GSM library only works for Official GSM shield.)

 

Auto Configure, Program over Air, Easy to Customize

IOT device means your projects stay out in field, in farm, in the hands, in car and homes of users, where they belong. So best way to work with it is take away the wires and do whatever configuration on air. Easy to set up and work out of box, easy to customize.

Yes our device allows you One time Auto configuration according to mobile network and it is ready to connect with Internet. Program, configure your software in web environments, also we deliver update firmware to your device over the web. (But still you can program the device by USB or from uSD card).

 

Works both off-net and On-net, Global base band supported

Cellular IOT Board is an open device, not locked to any particular network. It works in all countries that provide GSM/3G/LTE-based network services. Our customised Firmware allows you control your device off-net just by voice call, texting or SMS as well as On-net through GPRS. So if you have our device on Mt Everest, you can connect it.

 

Open source platform and Design to Hack.

This device is totally open source. All our hardware design files and firmware will be available on internet under Creative common licence.

Interfacing details, libraries, schematics and all technical support will be available on our website for following popular development platforms. 

OR

Yes, our device has a very powerful 32-bit ARM processor incore, which has 1MB flash memory, 1MB RAM, 1MB EEROM and additional IO pins for additional embbeded application. Now you can add some more stuffs and an option for On-board high sensitive GPS module, uSD card datalogger.

Even you can configure it to run as stand-alone Web server or configure as client with TCP/UDP protocol. It also supports HTTPS protocol.

We have  also added voltage level shifter for UART pins, so you do not need external level shifter for 3.3V to 5V interfacing. With independent Arduino Extensions you can do hassle free interfacing for both 5V and 3.3V standard breaouts and sensors modules.

Application possibilities are endless if you have the idea and want to make cool things or use it inside your product.

 

Powered with Python

Configure device built-in features IO pins, PWM, ADC, GPS, and Memory etc. with Python script editor. Modify API and store settings in uSD card.

 

 

Technical Specification

Basic Features

  • Arduino compatible layout. (Arduino vR3 layout)
  • GSM Base-band (850/900/1800/1900)MHz
  • Auto configuration for global mobile network.
  • On-board uSD card socket for data logging & push-in simcard socket.
  • On board Antenna and SMA connector for External Antenna.
  • On board Li-ion battery charging and power circuit.
  • USB 2.0 interface with Dual Mini and Micro USB port
  • On board 3.3v-5V level shifter for GSM and GPS* UART interface***
  • Wide range voltage input with Switch mode power supply**
  • Custom firmware for wide range of Applications
  • Python Script supported.

Hardware Specification

  • SIM900 SOC GSM module
  • Based on ARM926EJ core Runs at 156MHz
  • 1MB usable flash memory, 1MB RAM
  • Internal EEPROM 1MB and external memory by uSD up to 8GB
  • 12 Digital IO
  • 2 PWM
  • 2 ADC (Including battery voltage monitor ADC)
  • In-built RTC
  • 1 UART, Debug UART, GPS UART*, i2c
  • Both USB and Battery power supported
  • More (Add hyper link to device datasheet)

GPS Features and Specification*

  • MTK MT3339 , L1-1575.42 MHz, 66-Channels
  • DGPS and AGPS supported
  • Baud rate supported up to 115200
  • High update rate up to 10MHz
  • EPO enable 14 days
  • Automatic Antenna Switching
  • Advance Power periodic mode for Power Saving
  • Internal GPS processing for
    1. One sentence Output
    2. Last position Retention
    3. Geofencing (up to 10000m)
    4. Distance calculation between coordinates
    5. Internal logger

*On board GPS and all features related to GPS application is only available to Model B Cellular IOT board.

**Use power adaptor or USB power as primary source. Make sure battery connected, Sourcing power from Arduino boards is not recommended.

***This board runs at 3.7-4.2V. The maximum voltage that the I/O pins can tolerate is 3.3V. Connecting the I/O pins to higher voltages, including 5V, could damage the board. Only selective UART port are supported with voltage level shifter.

 

What is in the KIT ?

Each Kit will have one set of Cellular IOT board (Model A or Model B) and some accessories listed below.

This Cellular IOT development platform is available in two versions

  1. Model A
  2. Model B

Model B has all the features of Model A, in addition it comes with a high sensitive 66-channel GPS module which is preloaded with our custom firmware for advance applications like location base IOT.

Accessories

  • USB cable with every board
  • Stackable header pin set with every board
  • 6 Jumper wires
  • 50ohm SMA Antenna with every board
  • 3.7V 700mAh Li-Ion Battery only on selective perk
  • 25A SSR only with selective perk

 

Our Rewards to Contributors

 

Project Time Line and Production Schedule

SEPT-OCT 2012 Concept Design, Project line up. COMPLETE
NOV-DEC 2012 Circuit development, EVB Testing COMPLETE
JAN-FEB 2013 V1.0 prototype Development
V1.0 prototype further testing		 COMPLETE
MAR-APRIL 2013 V2.0 prototype developed V2.0 prototype final testing COMPLETE
MAY-JUNE 2013 Field test & Design for Manufacture COMPLETE
JULY 2013 Pre-campaign preparation COMPLETE
AUG- SEPT 2013 Indiegogo Campaign IN PROCESS
SEPT-OCT 2013 Component Resourcing, Production Starts SCHEDULED
NOVEMBER 2013 Shipping Starts SCHEDULED

Meet the Creators

Who we are?

Hello I am Chinmay. I do all the Hardware making stuff. 

Contact me: chinmay@popins.in

 

Hi! I am Sujit. I do all the Software magic stuff.

Contact me: sujit@popins.in

Why are you creating it?

We both are professional embedded developer and big Arduino fan boy. We have very strong experience on prototype designs based on GSM, GPS, Wi-Fi, RF and sensor networks. We understand the term “Internet Of Things" very seriously.

In one of our project development process we discover unnoticed features of SIM900 GSM modules. SIM900 modules generally make communication with AT commands, but its manufacturer also supports to develop and run custom Embedded API on it, which makes it a different playground to do some more good work. Unfortunately this embedded application is not available for general SIM900 modules, it need custom firmware to load in order to use it additional features.

So we decided to make these useful features accessible to open source community.

Why are you trying to make it affordable?

We did small research and found that there are many GSM Shields available in different parts of world, but neither of them are design to work standalone nor they support any embedded application development. You need always an additional, external microcontroller to use it. In addition they are expensive to use, even official Arduino GSM shield cost over US$100.

But we finally find way to make A Cellular IOT development platform but in affordable cost.

Why are you doing a crowd funding campaign at IndieGoGo?

We want this product to be accessible to Makers, Inventors, Engineers, Educators, Farmers, and Beginners for their creative requirement, but at the same time we want it affordable to them.

So we did the math and it turned out, if we rise at least US$10,000, then we can do a first run for 200 pieces of these boards. That brings the manufacturing cost down and we can make this board affordable to everyone. All fund raised here at IndieGoGo campaign will be used to pay for components resourcing and manufacturing cost.

But this can be only possible with your support and feedback.

How are you manufacturing the circuits for the orders placed?

We have our own Fab-house with manufacturing setups for low to mid volume production. All the boards will be manufacture in-house only. We have good supply chain network, which ensure us the availability of all components according to BOM (Bill of Materials) are in stocks. So we have confident to deliver this product on schedule.

Where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal?

If we do not meet the target number, don’t panic. We got our piggy banks and hammer ready to score the number. We will make it successful.

 

Shipping

As we said before, the goal is make it affordable, which means shipping cost also comes under consideration. The best solution for shipping from our place is Registered Airmail from INDIA POST. This is affordable & fast enough as the shipment delivers in less than a week to most of the larger Countries. Plus it offers an online tracking system. At the time of shipping you will receive an e-mail with the confirmation and tracking number. You will receive the product in Bubble envelope. As the real value of the product is very low, no Countries should apply customs duties, we will despatch envelope with CN22 custom declaration. The sealed envelope weighted appx. 400grams. Shipping cost is US$8 (including packaging) for worldwide shipping.

FAQs

I contributed to a perk but I forgot to add the extra $8 for shipping. How can I increase the amount?

No problem! If you'd like to add funds for shipping, you can make another contribution and select "No Perk, Just a Contribution."

If I have further questions where can I contact . 

You can reach us at support@popins.in .

Basic Features

Arduino compatible layout. (Arduino vR3 layout)
GSM Base-band (850/900/1800/1900)MHz
Auto configuration for global mobile network.
On-board uSD card socket for data logging & push-in simcard socket.
On board Antenna and SMA connector for External Antenna.
On board Li-ion battery charging and power circuit.
USB 2.0 interface with Dual Mini and Micro USB port
On board 3.3v-5V level shifter for GSM and GPS* UART interface***
Wide range voltage input with Switch mode power supply**
Custom firmware for wide range of Applications
Python Script supported.

Hardware Specification

SIM900 SOC GSM module
Based on ARM926EJ core Runs at 156MHz
1MB usable flash memory, 1MB RAM
Internal EEPROM 1MB and external memory by uSD up to 8GB
12 Digital IO
2 PWM
2 ADC (Including battery voltage monitor ADC)
In-built RTC
1 UART, Debug UART, GPS UART*, i2c
Both USB and Battery power supported
More (Add hyper link to device datasheet)

GPS Features and Specification*

MTK MT3339 , L1-1575.42 MHz, 66-Channels
DGPS and AGPS supported
Baud rate supported up to 115200
High update rate up to 10MHz
EPO enable 14 days
Automatic Antenna Switching
Advance Power periodic mode for Power Saving
Internal GPS processing for
One sentence Output
Last position Retention
Geofencing (up to 10000m)
Distance calculation between coordinates
Internal logger



*On board GPS and all features related to GPS application is only available to Model B Cellular IOT board.
**Use power adaptor or USB power as primary source. Make sure battery connected, Sourcing power from Arduino boards is not recommended.
***This board runs at 3.7-4.2V. The maximum voltage that the I/O pins can tolerate is 3.3V. Connecting the I/O pins to higher voltages, including 5V, could damage the board. Only selective UART port are supported with voltage level shifter.
 
What is in the KIT ?
Each Kit will have one set of Cellular IOT board (Model A or Model B) and some accessories listed below.
This Cellular IOT development platform is available in two versions

Model A
Model B

Model B has all the features of Model A, in addition it comes with a high sensitive 66-channel GPS module which is preloaded with our custom firmware for advance applications like location base IOT.
Accessories

USB cable with every board
Stackable header pin set with every board
6 Jumper wires
50ohm SMA Antenna with every board
3.7V 700mAh Li-Ion Battery only on selective perk
25A SSR only with selective perk




 
Our Rewards to Contributors

 
Project Time Line and Production Schedule


SEPT-OCT
2012
Concept Design, Project line up.
COMPLETE


NOV-DEC
2012
Circuit development, EVB Testing
COMPLETE


JAN-FEB
2013
V1.0 prototype DevelopmentV1.0 prototype further testing
COMPLETE


MAR-APRIL
2013
V2.0 prototype developed V2.0 prototype final testing
COMPLETE


MAY-JUNE
2013
Field test & Design for Manufacture
COMPLETE


JULY
2013
Pre-campaign preparation
COMPLETE


AUG- SEPT
2013
Indiegogo Campaign
IN PROCESS


SEPT-OCT
2013
Component Resourcing, Production Starts
SCHEDULED


NOVEMBER
2013
Shipping Starts
SCHEDULED


Meet the Creators
Who we are?

Hello I am Chinmay. I do all the Hardware making stuff. 
Contact me: chinmay@popins.in
 

Hi! I am Sujit. I do all the Software magic stuff.
Contact me: sujit@popins.in
Why are you creating it?
We both are professional embedded developer and big Arduino fan boy. We have very strong experience on prototype designs based on GSM, GPS, Wi-Fi, RF and sensor networks. We understand the term “Internet Of Things" very seriously.
In one of our project development process we discover unnoticed features of SIM900 GSM modules. SIM900 modules generally make communication with AT commands, but its manufacturer also supports to develop and run custom Embedded API on it, which makes it a different playground to do some more good work. Unfortunately this embedded application is not available for general SIM900 modules, it need custom firmware to load in order to use it additional features.
So we decided to make these useful features accessible to open source community.
Why are you trying to make it affordable?
We did small research and found that there are many GSM Shields available in different parts of world, but neither of them are design to work standalone nor they support any embedded application development. You need always an additional, external microcontroller to use it. In addition they are expensive to use, even official Arduino GSM shield cost over US$100.
But we finally find way to make A Cellular IOT development platform but in affordable cost.
Why are you doing a crowd funding campaign at IndieGoGo?
We want this product to be accessible to Makers, Inventors, Engineers, Educators, Farmers, and Beginners for their creative requirement, but at the same time we want it affordable to them.
So we did the math and it turned out, if we rise at least US$10,000, then we can do a first run for 200 pieces of these boards. That brings the manufacturing cost down and we can make this board affordable to everyone. All fund raised here at IndieGoGo campaign will be used to pay for components resourcing and manufacturing cost.
But this can be only possible with your support and feedback.
How are you manufacturing the circuits for the orders placed?
We have our own Fab-house with manufacturing setups for low to mid volume production. All the boards will be manufacture in-house only. We have good supply chain network, which ensure us the availability of all components according to BOM (Bill of Materials) are in stocks. So we have confident to deliver this product on schedule.
Where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal?
If we do not meet the target number, don’t panic. We got our piggy banks and hammer ready to score the number. We will make it successful.
 
Shipping
As we said before, the goal is make it affordable, which means shipping cost also comes under consideration. The best solution for shipping from our place is Registered Airmail from INDIA POST. This is affordable & fast enough as the shipment delivers in less than a week to most of the larger Countries. Plus it offers an online tracking system. At the time of shipping you will receive an e-mail with the confirmation and tracking number. You will receive the product in Bubble envelope. As the real value of the product is very low, no Countries should apply customs duties, we will despatch envelope with CN22 custom declaration. The sealed envelope weighted appx. 400grams. Shipping cost is US$8 (including packaging) for worldwide shipping.
FAQs
I contributed to a perk but I forgot to add the extra $8 for shipping. How can I increase the amount?
No problem! If you'd like to add funds for shipping, you can make another contribution and select "No Perk, Just a Contribution."
If I have further questions where can I contact . 
You can reach us at support@popins.in .

story:
In 2010, 9.4 million people owned but over 27 million people enjoyed riding a motorcycle.  The majority of people in the USA who ride do not own a motorcycle. This group has been relegated to borrowing a friends bike or renting one from time to time.  Jupiter's MotoShare service is for the 17.6 million people in the USA looking for a better way to ride motorcycles.

Jupiter's was launched by me, Chris Miles in 2009 - born of my passion for riding and frustration with the lack of rental and other services available for motorcycle riders.  In 2013, we will add "remote access" - the same technology that allows members to get on a bike anywhere at anytime like Zipcar. By 2014-2015 you will begin to see Jupiter's in other parts of the country - providing you with great motorcycles to ride with none of the hassles or responsibility of ownership.

When Jupiter's MotoShare accepted our first member, Tom Burke and first fractional owner, Nick Baker the idea of sharing motorcycles through this service was born.  (Thank you both for believing in the idea.)  Both Tom, who pays a monthly fee and Nick, who shared his motorcycle have gotten to ride a variety of bikes without any of the hassle or responsibility of ownership.

The common problems: Cost, Hassle, Variety and Community.  

  • Problem 1) Cost - Why pay for something I only use 7 months a year? Garage parking for just the winter is at least $150 per month. Or my partner doesn't understand why I pay for insurance on something I use once a month.
  • Problem 2) Hassle - Taking care of a motorcycle requires knowledge, time and money.  Some of the best drivers of all time had no interest or understanding of mechanics.  For some, scheduling a maintenance, never mind doing an oil change, tires or brake pads yourself is too much. 
  • Problem 3) Variety - I want to ride different motorcycles.  Not all bikes are the same.  For a long trip I want a comfortable bike but for a day trip give me something fast.  Owning 1 bike is doable but owning 10 is impossible both time and cost wise.  
  • Problem 4) Community - Most of my friends do not ride and making friends that do can be a challenge.

Since our first members joined, Jupiter's community of riders has found a solution for these problems - MotoShare.  By sharing the cost and motorcycles with each other, everybody gets access to more bikes, with no hassle for a lower price. 

Our community believes this is better option than owning a motorcycle and is committed to making Jupiter's accessible to as many people as possible.  We have our initial commitment to build out our remote access services (similar to that of ZipCar) in NYC for 2013.  But help us make this a huge success and you will have Jupiter's in your city too.

How would you like to ride one of these?

Say hello to the Brammo Empluse - the first 6 speed transmission ELECTRIC Motorcycle. 

Brammo Empulse
 
This handsome bike is the Triumph Tiger 800  - it has an amazing 3 cylinder 800 cc Engine that can do anything.
 
Triumph Tiger 800

Or, for the formal events you can take the Moto Guzzi v7 - classic styling with the reliability of today's modern motorcycles.

Moto Guzzi v7

This is our gift to all of our supporters - Jupiter's T- Shirts comes in Heather Grey, Black and Green.  Sizes from XS - XXL in both Men and Women's.  Shirts are American Apparel Cotton-Poly 50/50 and are super comfortable.

Jupiter's T-Shirt - Men & Women Sizes XS-XXL

Help make Jupiter's the ZipCar for motorcycles by making the commitment to become a member today or by sharing this with others who need this service. The more support for Jupiter's the sooner you will see this in not just NYC but your city.  

For less than the cost of owning 1 motorcycle, Jupiter's can help you have 10's or 100's of different motorcycles ready for you to ride around the country.

story:
**IMPORTANT**

NOT ONLY DO WE NOT NEED THIS MONEY, WE ENCOURAGE YOU TO NOT DONATE UNLESS YOU ARE SURE! We do not need this money. there is enough money in the kitty to keep us running for months. we have recieved bad press recently for making money from this, what people dont understand is that we have touched none of it. we pay the admins, and run the cost of the server, and the rest goes to a kitty we will use when donations stop! Whether you believe that or not is your choice, but thats what happens :) 

Currently there is enough money in the kitty to last us, if the donations STOP NOW, another: 5 months.

AFTER DONATING, PLEASE LEAVE YOUR INGAME NAME AND PREFERRED GUN IF APPLICABLE IN THE COMMENTS TAB!!! WE CAN NOT PUT GUNS OR ANY OTHER ITEMS IN BACKPACKS!

We have been required to introduce a cost to perk changes for two reasons. one, because it takes a fair amount of time to remake a perk, and two, it is easier for us to keep track of who has what, and the extra need to keep records of how many changes have been made etc.


you can NOT spawn with any of the following:

1. items in BAGS

2. repair equipment (tyres, fuel etc)

3. rpgs, satchel charges, grenades or smoke grenades

4. radio

5. bags any larger than Alice size

6. any form of machine gun


IF YOU DONATE, the procedure for spawning with weapons is as such:

step 1; create a new character

step 2; once logged in, log out within 25 minutes of creating the character, and wait at the lobby for 1 minute

step 3; log back in, once logged in, you will have your weapons and will spawn at your vehicle location (if you have that perk)

step 4; if this does not work, repeat. if it still does not work, contact krauterz or mancow ingame or on teamspeak.
step 5; DONATORS CAN NOT CHANGE THEIR PERKS ONCE THE ORIGINAL REQUEST HAS BEEN PROCESSED!

**DONATION PERK RULES**

*1 DO NOT TELL ANYONE THE LOCATION OF VEHICLES!

*2 no deliberate trolling, or exploiting. this includes using vehicles that you have not got the perk access to use

*3 NO SPAWN CAMPING. it is ok to sit in capitals and murder innocents, but give them a change to get out of the city first..

*4 NO WASTING VEHICLES. dont crash one helicopter into 8 others..


*5 TRY NOT TO ADD TOO MANY VEHICLES TO THE GAME! take a chopper to a capital, but HIDE IT WELL. OR imobilize it.

*6 AND FINALLY, DONT DEATHMATCH OR SHOOT OTHERS AT PERK LOCATIONS!!! it takes up to 10 minutes to respawn there each time. please dont do it! DOING IT WILL RESULT IN A ONE DAY BAN, second warning is removal of perks for 2 days, third warning is permenant removal of perks.

*7 WE OFFER FULL REFUNDS FOR DONATIONS FOR ONLY 48 HOURS. AND ONLY IF PLAYER GIVES A RELIABLE REASON FOR THEIR REFUND REQUEST! THIS IS A DONATION SYSTEM! NOT A PAY TO RECEIVE SYSTEM!

**DONATING ACCEPTS THESE RULES. BREAKING RULES MAY RESULT IN SUSPENSION OF PERKS, REMOVAL OF PERKS AND DEPENDING ON THE MAGNITUDE OF THE INCIDENT, BANS MAY BE APPLIED**

Short Summary

ZUST is the most popular Day-Z sanctuary (private hive) server currently running. Funding is running well, the server is stable and we do not need any donations. however, due to popular demand, we will be keeping this donation page up :)

(the reason the perks are not cheaper, is so that not too many people are running around with 50 cals ;)
we just upgraded our server! its now an 8 core with HT (meaning 16 virtual cores!) 8gb of ram and almost 1gbps connection!


What We Need & What You Get
Realisticly, all we need is one months worth of funding, which is $560. ($260 for the server and $300 to hire 3 full time RDC admins) however, the more we collect, the better this server will become. more money means more slots, better uptime and less lag. granted, at the moment we are not looking to expand, but any excess money made gets added to a kitty, which will be used in the event that donations stop :)


QUIRKS INCLUDE WEAPONS AND VEHICLES! depending on how much you donate, we can set you up with weapons, and other items. if you donate a lot, we can even make you spawn at a bunch of Hueys, littlebirds and MI-17's. If we do not reach our goal of $460, no big problem, money will be taken from the kitty to pay for the server until funding is at its target once again.

The Impact
You will be securing ZUST's future in the world of Day-Z. This includes standalone, and many many months, if not years to come.



Other Ways You Can Help
If you cant donate, dont worry, just like us on facebook! and of course feel free to connect to our server to talk directly to an admin!

connect to our TeamSpeak and just talk to us! we like to make new friends :)

($260 for the server and $300 to hire 3 full time RDC admins) however, the more we collect, the better this server will become. more money means more slots, better uptime and less lag. granted, at the moment we are not looking to expand, but any excess money made gets added to a kitty, which will be used in the event that donations stop :)QUIRKS INCLUDE WEAPONS AND VEHICLES! depending on how much you donate, we can set you up with weapons, and other items. if you donate a lot, we can even make you spawn at a bunch of Hueys, littlebirds and MI-17's. story:
Overview

Visualgen is multiplatform JAVA application for visualization and control of your embedded systems and other  hardware which can communicate with serial communication. With communication manager you can declare your protocol for data exchange. One of function of this program is Arduino code generator  which is useful for people with Arduino and programming beginners. You can upload generated code via remote upload  from internet.

   Main functions  of application are free but for remote develop, upload and control of your project from internet you need activate Online manager. You can connect to another application or ethernet shield via IP connection, but this way is often blocked by firewall or NAT. In this case you can use User connection which  is established by our control server(for this functionality you need online manager activated for at least for 2 APP/DEV connections).

Target of this campaign is to get money for increasing functionality of application and running server for online connections managing and support. Please, donate us.

Features

- Visualization of created project  on multiple screens
- Buttons, edits, sliders for control system
- Tables, plots, bars, edits and graphic warns for program output
- Scheduler for time planning
- Commander for simple external programming
- User defined communication protocol
- Code generator
- Fast variables and hardware configuration
- Commands and variables data exchange
- Control I/O outputs
- Support for libraries: SD, servo, Ethernet, display , IR , EEPROM
- Commands and declarations of functions
- Encrypted communication with user defined key
- Serial communication
- Support for more devices in star topology
- Redirecting and sharing communication with external applications
- Internet control even behind NAT
- Control from website
- Data storage in CSV
- Remote upload from internet
- Useful with lot of DIY hardware

Campaign goals

5 000 - Project will be delivered in complete version in May 2015. 

10 000 - Live camera streaming  and joystick control support (August 2015)

15 000 - User code  manager with possibility of exchange with another users (September 2015)

Download

You can Download beta version of  application on project page. After registration you will get  test license for 3 APP/DEV which expires 1. May 2015.

Inteligent room tutorial

 

History  of project

This project started like hobby project for home usage to control light and PC with one remote controller. In first version project  generate just code for communication but after time  we add anothers  code generator functions for variable declarations and IO control. After year of developing (in freetime) project joined  to  university  competition, where he won first place. 

FAQ

1. What is online manager for?

It helps application establish connection to another application. Your activated application will connect to our server and provide infromation for connection . Also you can control your project from webcontrol user interface.

2. Does application run in every type of connection?

No, connection in mobile networks like 3G, 4G can not be established.

3. How does remote upload work?

  You have to run 2 applications. First is your source, second is with connected board and  assigned Arduino IDE 1.5.8.Source application will transfer your project to secondary application and upload it.

4. What means Redirecting and sharing communication?

  Application can read and write communication to another software. This can be usable with user scripts, software for control PC,  Matlab,etc..   tutorial

5. How can I make project better?

 Your suggestions you can send via project page  support chat, mail or forum.

Others 

1. Perks are for one year of usage

2. Schemas in videos are created by Fritzing.org

3. Logos in video bellong to Arduino.cc, RaspberryPi, STM32
